content:
NetNamedPipeBindingElement Class

Definition

Represents a configuration element that defines a binding that is secure, reliable and optimized for on-machine cross process communication.

In this Article

public class NetNamedPipeBindingElement : System.ServiceModel.Configuration.StandardBindingElement
Inheritance
Object
ConfigurationElement
ServiceModelConfigurationElement
System.ServiceModel.Configuration.StandardBindingElement
NetNamedPipeBindingElement

Remarks

By default, this binding generates a run-time communication stack with WS-ReliableMessaging for reliability, transport security for transfer security, named pipes for message delivery, and binary message encoding.

Constructors

NetNamedPipeBindingElement()

Initializes a new instance of the NetNamedPipeBindingElement class.

public NetNamedPipeBindingElement ();

NetNamedPipeBindingElement(String)

Initializes a new instance of the NetNamedPipeBindingElement class with the specified name.

public NetNamedPipeBindingElement (string name);
name
String

The configuration name of the binding. This value should be unique because it is used as identification for the binding.

Properties

BindingElementType

Gets the type of this configuration element.

protected override Type BindingElementType { get; }
Value
Type

The Type of this configuration element.

HostNameComparisonMode

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the hostname is used to reach the service when matching on the URI.

public System.ServiceModel.HostNameComparisonMode HostNameComparisonMode { get; set; }
Value
HostNameComparisonMode

A stem.ServiceModel.Configuration.WSDualHttpBindingElement.HostNameComparisonMode* value that specifies whether the hostname is included when routing incoming requests to an endpoint URI. The default value is HostNameComparisonMode, which ignores the hostname in the match.

MaxBufferPoolSize

Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer pool.

public long MaxBufferPoolSize { get; set; }
Value
Int64

The maximum size of the buffer pool. The default is 524,288 bytes (512 * 1024).

Remarks

Many parts of Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) use buffers. Creating and destroying buffers each time they are used is expensive, and garbage collection for buffers is also expensive. With buffer pools, you can take a buffer from the pool, use it, and return it to the pool once you are done. Thus the overhead in creating and destroying buffers is avoided.

MaxBufferSize

Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer used to store messages in memory.

public int MaxBufferSize { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The maximum number of bytes that are used to buffer incoming messages in memory. The default value is 65,536 bytes.

Remarks

This property only applies to the headers of streamed messages. This value should be at least the maximum possible size of the SOAP headers, which are read in buffered mode.

If the buffer is full, excess data remains in the underlying socket until the buffer has space again.

The value of this property must be less than or equal to MaxMessageSize and must be larger than the size of the headers of the message or the channel throws an exception.

If you receive more data than you can buffer, the channel throws a CommunicationException, which contains QuotaExceededException as an inner exception.

MaxConnections

Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of outbound and inbound connections the service creates and accepts respectively.

public int MaxConnections { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The maximum number of outbound and inbound connections the service creates and accepts respectively. The default is 10.

Remarks

Incoming and outgoing connections are counted against a separate limit specified by this property. Any connection in excess of the limit is queued until a space below the limit becomes available.

MaxReceivedMessageSize

Gets and sets the maximum allowable message size, in bytes, that can be received on a channel configured with this binding.

public long MaxReceivedMessageSize { get; set; }
Value
Int64

The maximum allowable message size that is processed by the binding. The default value is 65,536 bytes.

Properties

Gets a ConfigurationPropertyCollection instance that contains a collection of ConfigurationProperty objects that can be attributes or ConfigurationElement objects of this configuration element.

protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }
Value
ConfigurationPropertyCollection

A ConfigurationPropertyCollection instance that contains a collection of ConfigurationProperty objects that can be attributes or ConfigurationElement objects of this configuration element.

ReaderQuotas

Gets or sets constraints on the complexity of SOAP messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with this binding.

public System.ServiceModel.Configuration.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotasElement ReaderQuotas { get; }
Value
XmlDictionaryReaderQuotasElement

The XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas that specifies the complexity constraints.

Remarks

The complexity constraints include items such as a maximum element depth, a maximum length for string content within the message. The constraints protect against a class of denial of service (DOS) attacks that attempt to use message complexity to tie up endpoint processing resources.

Security

Gets the type of security settings to be used with this binding.

public System.ServiceModel.Configuration.NetNamedPipeSecurityElement Security { get; }
Value
NetNamedPipeSecurityElement

The NetNamedPipeSecurityElement that specifies the type of security settings to be used with this binding.

TransactionFlow

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the binding supports flowing WS-Transactions.

public bool TransactionFlow { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the binding supports flowing WS-Transactions; otherwise, false. The default is false.

TransactionProtocol

Gets or sets the transaction protocol to be used with this binding.

public System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol TransactionProtocol { get; set; }
Value
TransactionProtocol

A TransactionProtocol that specifies the transaction protocol to be used with this binding.

TransferMode

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether messages are buffered or streamed or a request or response.

public System.ServiceModel.TransferMode TransferMode { get; set; }
Value
TransferMode

A valid TransferMode value that specifies whether messages are buffered or streamed or a request or response.

Methods

InitializeFrom(Binding)

Initializes this binding configuration with the content of the specified binding configuration settings.

protected override void InitializeFrom (System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding binding);
binding
Binding

Binding configuration settings.

OnApplyConfiguration(Binding)

Applies the specified binding to this NetNamedPipeBindingElement instance.

protected override void OnApplyConfiguration (System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding binding);
binding
Binding

The binding to be applied.
